column11: type

column9: The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the income distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality.

column2: Income share of the top 10% (after tax)
column9: This is the income of the richest 10% as a share of total income.

column2: Income share of the bottom 50% (after tax)
column9: This is the income of the poorest 50% as a share of total income.
The Palma ratio is the share of total income of the top 10% divided by the share of the bottom 40%.

column2: Relative poverty: Share of people below 50% of the median income (after tax)
column4: Share in relative poverty (< 50% of the median)
column9: Relative poverty is measured in terms of a poverty line that rises and falls over time with average incomes – in this case set at 50% of the median income.
